head.title: A Fake Gun and an Arrest

hedline.hl1: A Fake Gun and an Arrest

abstract.p: Wojcieh Dziewomski is arrested in Atlantic City for waving fake gun while roaming city's casino strip for about 30 minutes threatening to shoot people (New Jersey Daily Briefing) (S)

block.p: Terrified gamblers took cover underneath benches and behind walls as a man waving a fake gun roamed the city's casino strip for about 30 minutes Sunday night before a gambler wrestled him to the ground. The man, Wojcieh Dziewomski, 29, of Margate, was first spotted wielding the small black pistol at a busy downtown intersection, then walked into the Atlantic City Medical Center and threatened to shoot people, said Detective Joseph LaTorre, a police spokesman.

The man, Wojcieh Dziewomski, 29, of Margate, was first spotted wielding the small black pistol at a busy downtown intersection, then walked into the Atlantic City Medical Center and threatened to shoot people, said Detective Joseph LaTorre, a police spokesman.

Minutes later, Detective LaTorre said, Mr. Dziewomski turned up at Caesars Atlantic City Hotel Casino, where he sat near a parking entrance waving the gun. More than 20 people fled or took cover, witnesses told The A.P. Mr. Dziewomski was charged with possession of a fake weapon.
